result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter W. Breclaw was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes: Payment of all court obligations and supervision fees.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge from bond.

No consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and taken according to Dr's instructions and as approved by agent.
No contact with any known drug dealers/users.
No contact with T.P.
Complete any counseling assessments and follow through as determined by agent and complete all programming as deemed by the COMPAS  assessment and the DOC.

timeConds.notes:
Huber release in in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.
May serve in any county.
No good time.
Defendant remanded

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
